column1: #Text=I went to your National Post comment, \"Dedicated prayer rooms at odds with secular schools\" (2011) and I would like to respond:
#Text=First, this is an article about Ontario provincial policies.
#Text=The use of \"Canada\" makes it seem the action is federal but it is provincial;

#Text=Second, I agree with an excerpt from the article: \"Barbara Kay in Montreal: I find it hutzpadik in the extreme for any religious group to ask for a designated space to pray in a secular institution.\"
#Text=I have already experienced the stripping of religious artifacts in classrooms years ago, when I lived in Ontario.
#Text=Although my early years were spent starting the day with the Christian \"Lord's Prayer\" and celebrating \"Christmas,\" schools I later attended ceased any connection with any religion.

#Text=Out of respect for the growing diversity of religions emerging in Ontario, only a photograph of the Queen was hung on the walls; no crosses, Bibles, genuflecting, crossing oneself or religious songs remained in the classroom.
#Text=Why should Islam be excepted and treated differently than Christianity?
#Text=If religion is left at home, a great deal of social conflict will be avoided.
